intro: Utricularia choristotheca, commonly known as the bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called utricles, which function as trap organs to capture small aquatic organisms. This plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Utricularia choristotheca is an epiphytic or submerged plant, often growing on the surfaces of other plants or in water. Its unique morphology and carnivorous adaptation make it a fascinating subject in botanical studies.
